title: Person of Interest 2.21 Finch and Root conversation about the Machine
author: George Finch
comment: Never realized the time it takes to reboot, 1.618 is the golden ratio
The guilt and defiance in Finch and the palpable sadness in Root are played so well here. Amazing actors. Great dialogue

It is brilliant if you think about it. The machine realized its weakness, and so wrote special code to preserve the loss of memories, that would be taken away at midnight. Finch clearly always had God Mode access. He just never wanted it or knew it, so now he feels bad.

I've always had this scene on the hook, but now I understand why Finch deletes it's identity. 

Our identities are things we didn't choose.
I like how both the Machine's theme and Root's theme start to mesh towards the end
